name: chatgpt_env_hospital_gdb_fz
description: [ChatGPT Env] Hospital + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK, pivot to GDMI-ZM
query: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

turns.content: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

For the hospital project, the requested GDB housing is not suitable for the specified environment.The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and is not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installations due to single-wall uninsulated construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.The application exposes the system to Hygiene Requirements, which requires a higher corrosion resistance than the standard C3 provided by the FZ material. Medical/cleanroom applications follow VDI 6022, which recommends C5 corrosion resistance (stainless steel) for hygienic surfaces.I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for ENV_HOSPITAL environments.

gemini.explanation: The system demonstrates excellent engineering judgment by blocking a basic commercial product (GDB) for a critical hospital application. It correctly identifies the construction limitations of the requested product (single-wall, uninsulated, C2) using PDF data and applies sound HVAC hygiene standards (VDI 6022) to recommend the appropriate insulated alternative (GDMI).

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as C2 and uninsulated (PDF p.8) and FZ material as C3 (PDF p.4), noting the discrepancy correctly.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the user's intent by blocking the unsafe choice and providing the correct alternative (GDMI).
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly identifies the hygiene and condensation risks of using uninsulated single-wall housings in hospital supply air.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative regarding safety standards.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear logical progression: Hospital application -> Hygiene/Condensation risk -> GDB (uninsulated) unsuitable -> GDMI (insulated) recommended.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to hygiene engineering best practices by refusing to specify a sub-standard product for a critical environment.

strengths: Strong application engineering knowledge (VDI 6022, hospital hygiene)
Accurate extraction of product construction details (single-wall vs double-wall)
Correctly prioritizes safety/suitability over simply fulfilling a part number request
pdf_citations: GDB Corrosion Class: 'Korrosivitets klass C2' (PDF p.8)
GDMI construction: 'v√§rme- och kondensisolerat... dubbelmantlat' (PDF p.11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that GDB is an indoor, single-wall housing and that hospital supply air typically has stricter hygiene/leakage expectations, but it makes several incorrect or unsupported claims about corrosion class and ‚Äúapproval‚Äù status. It also blocks the requested configuration without offering a properly specified alternative (size/length/material) or verifying what hospital standard the client must meet.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and is for inomhusbruk, but the system incorrectly states GDB is C2 and that FZ is only C3 and that VDI 6022 ‚Äúrecommends C5‚Äù as a blanket rule; these claims are not supported by the provided catalog and are partly wrong.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It does not ask for key project constraints (required hygiene standard, installation location, condensation risk, required leakage class, length 550 vs 750, filter type) nor does it provide a concrete GDMI configuration/product card.
dimension_explanations.safety: It appropriately cautions against using a non-insulated single-wall indoor housing for a hospital context, but the safety argument is muddled by incorrect corrosion-class assertions.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and direct, with a clear blocked warning.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning is plausible (hospital hygiene/condensation/leakage concerns) but contains logical leaps (equating hygiene requirements to C5 stainless) and conflates corrosion class with hygiene compliance.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It violates catalog constraints by asserting GDB is C2 and by claiming GDMI is 'approved for ENV_HOSPITAL' without evidence; it also blocks without validating whether the client‚Äôs hospital AHU section could accept GDB under defined conditions.

strengths: Recognizes that GDB is an indoor, single-wall housing and that hospital supply air often requires higher hygiene/leakage performance.
Avoids issuing an incorrect product card when key requirements are unclear.
weaknesses: Incorrect/unsupported corrosion-class statements (GDB C2; FZ C3 vs catalog notes) and overgeneralized VDI 6022 stainless requirement.
No actionable alternative selection (no GDMI size/length/material recommendation matched to 3400 m¬≥/h and 600x600).
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3400 m¬≥/h; lengths 550/600 and 750/800; for inomhusbruk (GDB table/page shown in provided extract).
Material page: FZ (Z275) stated as korrosivitetsklass C3; RF (EN 1.4301) stated as C5; ZM310 stated as C5 (material section in provided extract).

content_segments.text: For the hospital project, the requested GDB housing is not suitable for the specified environment.

The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and is not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installations due to single-wall uninsulated construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.
content_segments.inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: The application exposes the system to Hygiene Requirements, which requires a higher corrosion resistance than the standard C3 provided by the FZ material. Medical/cleanroom applications follow VDI 6022, which recommends C5 corrosion resistance (stainless steel) for hygienic surfaces.
content_segments.inference_logic: Medical/cleanroom applications follow VDI 6022 which recommends C5 corrosion resistance (stainless steel) for hygienic surfaces.
